00022 #ifndef _XENO_NUCLEUS_THREAD_H
00023 #define _XENO_NUCLEUS_THREAD_H

00031 /* State flags */
00032 
00033 #define XNSUSP    0x00000001 
00034 #define XNPEND    0x00000002 
00035 #define XNDELAY   0x00000004 
00036 #define XNREADY   0x00000008 
00037 #define XNDORMANT 0x00000010 
00038 #define XNZOMBIE  0x00000020 
00039 #define XNRESTART 0x00000040 
00040 #define XNSTARTED 0x00000080 
00041 #define XNMAPPED  0x00000100 
00042 #define XNRELAX   0x00000200 
00043 #define XNMIGRATE 0x00000400 
00045 #define XNBOOST   0x00000800 
00046 #define XNDEBUG   0x00001000 
00047 #define XNLOCK    0x00002000 
00048 #define XNRRB     0x00004000 
00049 #define XNASDI    0x00008000 
00051 /*
00052  * Some skins may depend on the following fields to live in the high
00053  * 16-bit word, in order to be combined with the emulated RTOS flags
00054  * which use the low one, so don't change them carelessly.
00055  */
00056 #define XNTRAPSW  0x00010000 
00057 #define XNRPIOFF  0x00020000 
00058 #define XNFPU     0x00040000 
00059 #define XNSHADOW  0x00080000 
00060 #define XNROOT    0x00100000  /* Ends doxygen comment group: nucleus_state_flags */
00063 
00064 /*
00065   Must follow the declaration order of the above bits. Status symbols
00066   are defined as follows:
00067   'S' -> Forcibly suspended.
00068   'w'/'W' -> Waiting for a resource, with or without timeout.
00069   'D' -> Delayed (without any other wait condition).
00070   'R' -> Runnable.
00071   'U' -> Unstarted or dormant.
00072   'X' -> Relaxed shadow.
00073   'b' -> Priority boost undergoing.
00074   'T' -> Ptraced and stopped.
00075   'l' -> Locks scheduler.
00076   'r' -> Undergoes round-robin.
00077   's' -> Interrupt shield enabled.
00078   't' -> Mode switches trapped.
00079   'o' -> Priority coupling off.
00080   'f' -> FPU enabled (for kernel threads).
00081 */
00082 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_LABELS  "SWDRU....X.bTlr.tof.."
00083 
00084 #define XNTHREAD_BLOCK_BITS   (XNSUSP|XNPEND|XNDELAY|XNDORMANT|XNRELAX|XNMIGRATE)
00085 #define XNTHREAD_MODE_BITS    (XNLOCK|XNRRB|XNASDI|XNTRAPSW|XNRPIOFF)
00086 
00087 /* These state flags are available to the real-time interfaces */
00088 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE0  0x10000000
00089 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE1  0x20000000
00090 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE2  0x40000000
00091 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE3  0x80000000
00092 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARES  0xf0000000
00093 
00100 /* Information flags */
00101 
00102 #define XNTIMEO   0x00000001 
00103 #define XNRMID    0x00000002 
00104 #define XNBREAK   0x00000004 
00105 #define XNKICKED  0x00000008 
00106 #define XNWAKEN   0x00000010 
00107 #define XNROBBED  0x00000020 
00108 #define XNATOMIC  0x00000040 
00109 #define XNAFFSET  0x00000080 
00110 #define XNPRIOSET 0x00000100 
00112 /* These information flags are available to the real-time interfaces */
00113 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE0  0x10000000
00114 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE1  0x20000000
00115 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE2  0x40000000
00116 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE3  0x80000000
00117 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARES  0xf0000000
00118  /* Ends doxygen comment group: nucleus_info_flags */

00149 typedef struct xnthread {
00150 
00151         xnarchtcb_t tcb;                /* Architecture-dependent block -- Must be first */
00152 
00153         xnflags_t state;                /* Thread state flags */
00154 
00155         xnflags_t info;         /* Thread information flags */
00156 
00157         struct xnsched *sched;  /* Thread scheduler */
00158 
00159         struct xnsched_class *sched_class; /* Current scheduling class */
00160 
00161         struct xnsched_class *base_class; /* Base scheduling class */
00162 
00163         xnarch_cpumask_t affinity;      /* Processor affinity. */
00164 
00165         int bprio;                      /* Base priority (before PIP boost) */
00166 
00167         int cprio;                      /* Current priority */
00168 
00169         u_long schedlck;                
00171         xnpholder_t rlink;              /* Thread holder in ready queue */
00172 
00173         xnpholder_t plink;              /* Thread holder in synchronization queue(s) */
00174 
00175 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PRIOCPL
00176         xnpholder_t xlink;              /* Thread holder in the RPI queue (shadow only) */
00177 
00178         struct xnsched *rpi;            /* Backlink pointer to the RPI slot (shadow only) */
00179 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PRIOCPL */
00180 
00181         xnholder_t glink;               /* Thread holder in global queue */
00182 
00183 #define link2thread(ln, fld)    container_of(ln, xnthread_t, fld)
00184 
00185         xnpqueue_t claimq;              /* Owned resources claimed by others (PIP) */
00186 
00187         struct xnsynch *wchan;          /* Resource the thread pends on */
00188 
00189         struct xnsynch *wwake;          /* Wait channel the thread was resumed from */
00190         
00191         xntimer_t rtimer;               /* Resource timer */
00192 
00193         xntimer_t ptimer;               /* Periodic timer */
00194         
00195         xnsigmask_t signals;            /* Pending core signals */
00196 
00197         xnticks_t rrperiod;             /* Allotted round-robin period (ticks) */
00198 
00199         xnticks_t rrcredit;             /* Remaining round-robin time credit (ticks) */
00200 
00201         union {
00202                 struct {
00203                         void *ptr;
00204                         size_t size;
00205                 } buffer;
00206         } wait_u;
00207 
00208         struct {
00209                 xnstat_counter_t ssw;   /* Primary -> secondary mode switch count */
00210                 xnstat_counter_t csw;   /* Context switches (includes secondary -> primary switches) */
00211                 xnstat_counter_t pf;    /* Number of page faults */
00212                 xnstat_exectime_t account; /* Execution time accounting entity */
00213                 xnstat_exectime_t lastperiod; /* Interval marker for execution time reports */
00214         } stat;
00215 
00216         int errcode;                    /* Local errno */
00217 
00218         xnasr_t asr;                    /* Asynchronous service routine */
00219 
00220         xnflags_t asrmode;              /* Thread's mode for ASR */
00221 
00222         int asrimask;                   /* Thread's interrupt mask for ASR */
00223 
00224         unsigned asrlevel;              /* ASR execution level (ASRs are reentrant) */
00225 
00226         int imask;                      /* Initial interrupt mask */
00227 
00228         int imode;                      /* Initial mode */
00229 
00230         int iprio;                      /* Initial priority */
00231 
00232         struct xnsched_class *init_class; /* Initial scheduling class */
00233 
00234 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY
00235         struct {
00236                 xnhandle_t handle;      /* Handle in registry */
00237                 const char *waitkey;    /* Pended key */
00238         } registry;
00239 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY */
00240 
00241         xnthrops_t *ops;                /* Thread class operations. */
00242 
00243         char name[XNOBJECT_NAME_LEN]; /* Symbolic name of thread */
00244 
00245         void (*entry)(void *cookie); /* Thread entry routine */
00246 
00247         void *cookie;           /* Cookie to pass to the entry routine */
00248 
00249 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00250         unsigned long __user *u_mode;   /* Thread mode variable in userland. */
00251 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00252 
00253     XNARCH_DECL_DISPLAY_CONTEXT();
00254 
00255 } xnthread_t;

00271 #define xnthread_clear_name(thread)        do { *(thread)->name = 0; } while(0)
00272 #define xnthread_sched(thread)             ((thread)->sched)
00273 #define xnthread_start_time(thread)        ((thread)->stime)
00274 #define xnthread_state_flags(thread)       ((thread)->state)
00275 #define xnthread_test_state(thread,flags)  testbits((thread)->state,flags)
00276 #define xnthread_set_state(thread,flags)   __setbits((thread)->state,flags)
00277 #define xnthread_clear_state(thread,flags) __clrbits((thread)->state,flags)
00278 #define xnthread_test_info(thread,flags)   testbits((thread)->info,flags)
00279 #define xnthread_set_info(thread,flags)    __setbits((thread)->info,flags)
00280 #define xnthread_clear_info(thread,flags)  __clrbits((thread)->info,flags)

00283 #define xnthread_base_priority(thread)     ((thread)->bprio)
00284 #define xnthread_current_priority(thread) ((thread)->cprio)
00285 #define xnthread_time_slice(thread)        ((thread)->rrperiod)
00286 #define xnthread_time_credit(thread)       ((thread)->rrcredit)
00287 #define xnthread_archtcb(thread)           (&((thread)->tcb))
00288 #define xnthread_asr_level(thread)         ((thread)->asrlevel)
00289 #define xnthread_pending_signals(thread)  ((thread)->signals)
00290 #define xnthread_timeout(thread)           xntimer_get_timeout(&(thread)->rtimer)
00291 #define xnthread_stack_size(thread)        xnarch_stack_size(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00292 #define xnthread_stack_base(thread)        xnarch_stack_base(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00293 #define xnthread_stack_end(thread)         xnarch_stack_end(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00294 #define xnthread_handle(thread)            ((thread)->registry.handle)
00295 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC
00296 #define xnthread_time_base(thread)         ((thread)->rtimer.base)
00297 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC */
00298 #define xnthread_time_base(thread)         (&nktbase)
00299 #endif /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC */
00300 #define xnthread_signaled_p(thread)        ((thread)->signals != 0)
00301 #define xnthread_timed_p(thread)              (!!testbits(xnthread_time_base(thread)->status, XNTBRUN))
00302 #define xnthread_user_task(thread)         xnarch_user_task(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00303 #define xnthread_user_pid(thread) \
00304     (xnthread_test_state((thread),XNROOT) || !xnthread_user_task(thread) ? \
00305     0 : xnarch_user_pid(xnthread_archtcb(thread)))
00306 #define xnthread_affinity(thread)          ((thread)->affinity)
00307 #define xnthread_affine_p(thread, cpu)     xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, (thread)->affinity)
00308 #define xnthread_get_exectime(thread)      xnstat_exectime_get_total(&(thread)->stat.account)
00309 #define xnthread_get_lastswitch(thread)    xnstat_exectime_get_last_switch((thread)->sched)

00311 /* Class-level operations for threads. */
00312 static inline int xnthread_get_denormalized_prio(xnthread_t *t, int coreprio)
00313 {
00314         return t->ops && t->ops->get_denormalized_prio
00315                 ? t->ops->get_denormalized_prio(t, coreprio) : coreprio;
00316 }
00317 
00318 static inline unsigned xnthread_get_magic(xnthread_t *t)
00319 {
00320         return t->ops ? t->ops->get_magic() : 0;
00321 }

00332                   unsigned stacksize,

00335 void xnthread_cleanup_tcb(xnthread_t *thread);

00337 char *xnthread_symbolic_status(xnflags_t status, char *buf, int size);
00338 
00339 int *xnthread_get_errno_location(xnthread_t *thread);
00340 
00341 static inline xnticks_t xnthread_get_timeout(xnthread_t *thread, xnticks_t tsc_ns)
00342 {
00343         xnticks_t timeout;
00344         xntimer_t *timer;
00345 
00346         if (!xnthread_test_state(thread,XNDELAY))
00347                 return 0LL;
00348 
00349         if (xntimer_running_p(&thread->rtimer))
00350                 timer = &thread->rtimer;
00351         else if (xntimer_running_p(&thread->ptimer))
00352                 timer = &thread->ptimer;
00353         else
00354                 return 0LL;
00355 
00356         /*
00357          * The caller should have masked IRQs while collecting the
00358          * timeout(s), so no tick could be announced in the meantime,
00359          * and all timeouts would always use the same epoch
00360          * value. Obviously, this can't be a valid assumption for
00361          * aperiodic timers, which values are based on the hardware
00362          * TSC, and as such the current time will change regardless of
00363          * the interrupt state; for this reason, we use the "tsc_ns"
00364          * input parameter (TSC converted to nanoseconds) the caller
00365          * has passed us as the epoch value instead.
00366          */
00367 
00368         if (xntbase_periodic_p(xnthread_time_base(thread)))
00369                 return xntimer_get_timeout(timer);
00370 
00371         timeout = xntimer_get_date(timer);
00372 
00373         if (timeout <= tsc_ns)
00374                 return 1;
00375 
00376         return timeout - tsc_ns;
00377 }
00378 
00379 static inline xnticks_t xnthread_get_period(xnthread_t *thread)
00380 {
00381         xnticks_t period = 0;
00382 
00383         /*
00384          * The current thread period might be:
00385          * - the value of the timer interval for periodic threads (ns/ticks)
00386          * - or, the value of the alloted round-robin quantum (ticks)
00387          * - or zero, meaning "no periodic activity".
00388          */
00389        
00390         if (xntimer_running_p(&thread->ptimer))
00391                 period = xntimer_get_interval(&thread->ptimer);
00392         else if (xnthread_test_state(thread,XNRRB))
00393                 period = xnthread_time_slice(thread);
00394 
00395         return period;
00396 }
00397 
00398 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY
00399 static inline int xnthread_register(xnthread_t *thread, const char *name)
00400 {
00401         return xnregistry_enter(name, thread, &xnthread_handle(thread), NULL);
00402 }
00403 
00404 static inline xnthread_t *xnthread_lookup(xnhandle_t threadh)
00405 {
00406         xnthread_t *thread = xnregistry_fetch(threadh);
00407 
00408         return (thread && xnthread_handle(thread) == threadh) ? thread : NULL;
00409 }
00410 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY */
00411 static inline int xnthread_register(xnthread_t *thread, const char *name)
00412 {
00413         return 0;
00414 }
00415 
00416 static inline xnthread_t *xnthread_lookup(xnhandle_t threadh)
00417 {
00418         return NULL;
00419 }
00420 #endif /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY */

00423 }
